item.title: Fulbright Workshop
item.dc:creator: daniel.rieck
item.content:encoded:
Have you thought about applying for a Fulbright award to study, conduct research, or serve as an English Teaching Assistant in another country? Would you like to learn more? Join April Seehafer, Director of the Distinguished Scholarships Program, along with a current WSU Fulbright semi-finalist as we talk about the benefits, break down the application process, and answer any questions you have! While this workshop is best for juniors and seniors, all interested students are invited to attend.

Please join us either:

  • Monday, April 15 from 12:10 to 1:00 p.m. in CUE 518 -OR-
  • Wednesday, April 17 from 5:10 to 6:00 p.m. in the Honors Lounge

item.title: Fulbright Workshop
item.dc:creator: daniel.rieck
item.content:encoded:
Have you thought about applying for a Fulbright award to study, conduct research, or serve as an English Teaching Assistant in another country? Would you like to learn more? Join April Seehafer, Director of the Distinguished Scholarships Program, along with a current WSU Fulbright semi-finalist as we talk about the benefits, break down the application process, and answer any questions you have! While this workshop is best for juniors and seniors, all interested students are invited to attend.

Please join us either:

  • Monday, April 15 from 12:10 to 1:00 p.m. in CUE 518 -OR-
  • Wednesday, April 17 from 5:10 to 6:00 p.m. in the Honors Lounge

item.title: Boren Workshop
item.dc:creator: daniel.rieck
item.content:encoded: This information session is open to all undergraduate and graduate students who are interested in learning languages and studying in world in world regions critical to U.S. interests including Africa, Asia, Eastern Europe, Eurasia, Latin America, the Caribbean, and the Middle East. (Canada, Australia, and New Zealand are excluded, as well as countries in Western Europe.) In general, successful candidates are interested in learning less commonly taught languages in countries that are significant to U.S. national security and are individuals committed to a career in the federal government. This workshop, hosted by the WSU Distinguished Scholarships Program, features Kyle Cox, Outreach and Recruitment Analyst for the Boren Awards. Mr. Cox will be on hand to detail the benefits of the scholarship, selection criteria, and answer any questions you may have.

item.title: Goldwater/STEM Students Workshop
item.dc:creator: daniel.rieck
item.content:encoded:
Goldwater awards are given to college juniors and seniors who intend to pursue research careers in the natural sciences, engineering, or math. All students interested in applying this year must attend one of the Goldwater workshops.

Important notes about this workshop:

  • The material covered in Goldwater/Stem Students workshops is the same; it is offered multiple times to accommodate schedules.
  • This workshop is available via zoom if necessary. Please contact distinguishedscholarships@wsu.edu to make arrangements.

item.title: Gilman Scholarship Workshop
item.dc:creator: daniel.rieck
item.content:encoded:
Find out more about the Benjamin A. Gilman International Scholarship and how to submit a competitive scholarship application. This free event, which is produced by the Office of International Programs, is for students interested in studying abroad who are Pell Grant eligible.

Note: The material covered in each of the Gilman Scholarship Workshops is the same; it is offered multiple times to accommodate schedules.

item.title: Intro workshop 2017 event body text
item.dc:creator: daniel.rieck
item.content:encoded:
In our interactive introductory workshops, we will get you acquainted with several nationally-competitive scholarships available to WSU students. We will explain how many of these scholarships require that you be endorsed by WSU, so attending some of our later workshops is mandatory for students interested in these awardsplus there are WSU deadlines to meet.

Note: the material covered in intro workshops 1, 2, and 3 is the same; it is only necessary to attend one of them.

item.title: Distinguished Scholars Celebration 2019
item.dc:creator: makhani
item.content:encoded: Over the past year, 15 WSU Distinguished Scholars have received prestigious, nationally competitive awards to boost their transformative educational experience. The Distinguished Scholars Celebration is the annual event to honor awardees, and recognize their mentors. WSU Provost and Executive Vice President Mitzi Montoya will be the guest speaker. An RSVP from those planning to attend would be appreciated.

item.title: Homepage Section: Upcoming Events
item.dc:creator: daniel.rieck
item.content:encoded:
Upcoming Events:
What We Do

Our Next Annual Event

Distinguished Scholars Celebration

At this annual event, the Distinguished Scholarships Program recognizes and honors the latest students and alumni to receive prestigious national awards. It also provides a venue to recognize faculty mentors and recommendation writers who helped the award applicants reach their goals. The university community and guests are invited to attend, and no RSVPs are necessary.

The next Distinguished Scholars Celebration will be held in fall 2019 in the recently renovated CUB ground-level gallery featuring all award winners. Learn moreabout this event >>
